newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Koramic books gain on Wienerberger deal.
newsitem.headline: Koramic books gain on Wienerberger deal.

text.p: Belgian building products group Koramic said in a statement on Thursday it would book a net current gain of 350 million Belgian francs on the sale by its Austrian partner Wienerberger Baustoffindustrie AG of an office development.

Wienerberger said on Thursday a 100 percent owned property promotion subsidiary had sold its "Business Park Vienna" development for three billion Austrian schillings, or around 8.8 billion francs. It said it had also acquired a minority stake in the buyer of the development, Immofinanz.

"The success of this operation frees up significant financial means, which will support the development of more property projects in Austria, but will be principally channelled to Koramic's main area of activity, building products," the Belgian company said.
The operation would also help 1997 results, it said.
Koramic owns 25 percent of Wienerberger Baustoffindustrie and 50 percent of the company's voting rights following a cross-border alliance cemented last year.
